meanings.definition: A syllogism in which one of the premises or the conclusion is not explicitly stated.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, the speaker used enthymemes to make his point without stating all the details.
meanings.sent2: The professor explained how enthymemes can be effective in persuasive writing.
meanings.sent3: The enthymemes at the end of the speech left the audience wondering about the missing pieces.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was like a puzzle with missing pieces, relying on enthymemes to connect the dots.
meanings.sent5: The concept of enthymemes is like a hidden message waiting to be uncovered.

meanings.definition: A rhetorical device that omits one or more premises of an argument.
meanings.sent1: The politician's speech was full of enthymemes, leaving the audience to fill in the missing parts.
meanings.sent2: As a master of persuasion, she often used enthymemes to make her arguments more impactful.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke relied on enthymemes, making the audience laugh at the implied premises.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive technique was like a magician's trick, using enthymemes to keep the audience guessing.
meanings.sent5: The power of enthymemes lies in what is left unsaid, creating intrigue and engagement.
